meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument.
meanings.sent1: I tried to persuade my friend to join the soccer team by telling him how fun it is.
meanings.sent2: She managed to persuade her parents to let her stay up late on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to persuade the dog to share its toy by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The colorful poster persuaded many people to attend the charity event.
meanings.sent5: His heartfelt speech was able to persuade even the toughest critics.

meanings.definition: Win over to a particular belief or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used examples to persuade the students that math can be fun.
meanings.sent2: He was able to persuade his colleagues to support his new project idea.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to persuade the audience that he could make a rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could persuade anyone to believe in the power of positivity.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset persuaded them to stay a little longer at the beach.
